response_requirements.initial_response_description: Must respond within 7 business days by making records available, denying request in writing, or providing estimated timeframe
response_requirements.final_response_notes: If not practicable to make records available promptly, must respond within 7 business days with production, denial, or estimated timeframe
response_requirements.extension_notes: May furnish estimated timeframe for production if not practicable within 7 business days
response_requirements.good_faith_standard: Custodian must make records available promptly or respond within 7 business days

fee_structure.search_fee: Labor charges may apply after first hour
fee_structure.search_fee_notes: May charge for labor after first hour of work
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Standard rates: $0.15 per page (black & white), $0.50 per page (color)
fee_structure.fee_waiver_notes: Cost estimates must be provided before charging fees
fee_structure.reasonableness_standard: Fees must be at reasonable cost; inspection is free of charge

exemptions.description: 563 exemptions found throughout Tennessee Code as of 2018
Records containing confidential information (must be redacted when possible)

appeal_process.first_level_notes: No administrative appeal; denied requesters may petition chancery or circuit court. Government bears burden of proof.
appeal_process.mediation_provider: Office of Open Records Counsel (guidance only, not individual requests)
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Attorney's fees may be awarded for willful violations
appeal_process.criminal_penalties_notes: Potential cost assessments against government for improper denials

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: Tennessee citizens only - photo ID with address may be required. No purpose statement required.
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Requests must be sufficiently detailed to identify specific records. No particular format required.
requester_requirements.specific_format: Can be submitted: in-person, phone, fax, mail, email, or online

agency_obligations.business_hours_notes: All records open during business hours unless otherwise provided by law
agency_obligations.electronic_submission_notes: May submit via email or online
agency_obligations.redaction_requirements: Records with confidential information must be redacted; redacted records made available for inspection
agency_obligations.liberal_interpretation: Courts instructed to give citizens fullest possible public access

oversight_body.name: Office of Open Records Counsel
oversight_body.role: Provides guidance and dispute assistance; develops standard response forms

primary_sources: Tennessee Code Annotated Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5, §§ 10-7-503 through 10-7-506
validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official Tennessee statutes. Response time set to null/variable per ground truth (statute requires response within 7 business days but timeline varies - may produce, deny, or provide estimate). Tennessee citizens only - residency requirement. Each entity must have written policy and designated PRRC. 563 exemptions throughout Tennessee Code. Office of Open Records Counsel provides guidance. Courts instruct to give fullest possible public access.
unique_characteristics: Tennessee citizens only - residency requirement enforced
7 business day response required (produce, deny, or estimate)
Office of Open Records Counsel oversight
Courts must construe to give fullest possible access
